events.title: Brown v. Board of Education Ruling
events.description: The U.S. Supreme Court delivered a unanimous decision declaring that racial segregation in public schools was unconstitutional.
events.significance: This landmark ruling helped to dismantle racial segregation in the United States and was a major victory for the Civil Rights Movement.

events.title: Signing of the Buttonwood Agreement
events.description: Twenty-four stockbrokers signed the Buttonwood Agreement in New York City, establishing the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE).
events.significance: This agreement marked the beginnings of one of the largest and most influential stock exchanges in the world, significantly impacting global finance.

events.title: Mickey Mouse Debuts
events.description: Walt Disney's iconic character Mickey Mouse made his first appearance in the cartoon 'Plane Crazy'.
events.significance: Mickey Mouse became a global cultural icon and symbol of the Walt Disney Company, influencing entertainment worldwide.

events.title: Winston Churchill Becomes British Prime Minister
events.description: Winston Churchill was appointed Prime Minister of the United Kingdom during World War II after Neville Chamberlain's resignation.
events.significance: Churchill's leadership was crucial in rallying Britain during WWII and shaping the Allied victory.

events.title: Integration of Little Rock Central High School Begins
events.description: Under federal troop protection, nine African American students, known as the Little Rock Nine, attempted to integrate Central High School in Arkansas.
events.significance: This event was a pivotal moment in the Civil Rights Movement, highlighting the struggle for desegregation in American schools.
